column4: gentlemen, is there any real reason the website is saying 64bit is NOT recommended for daily desktop use? i dont recall seeing that on any prior ubuntu releases
its idiot proofing .. and asked in here all the time.
im running 64bit now, so i assume its bogus
if a user dosent know if their cpu is 64 or 32bit.. then its best for them to get 32bit..
yep. Its  been reported as a bug even. :)
prob because there arent 64bit pkgs for everything and not weveryone knows how to install ia32lib? :P
ive have very few 64bit issues.. i can only think of 1 progam  thats ive used thats not 64bit now a days..
with a specific piece of legacy software that needed i32
i dident even try it with i32. i found an alterantive. :0 znes is 32bit only  it sems.. :)
heh, it aws wierd, OS reported file not found when trying to run the binary
